subtitle: This beautiful dish is superb for entertaining as it looks stunning and tastes divine.

method.text: For the mousseline, roughly chop the salmon pieces. Put into a blender or food processor and blend to a smooth puree. Slowly add the cream and egg white until all is incorporated. Season to taste.

Curl each sole fillet on its side and secure with a cocktail stick, leaving a cavity for the stuffing. Fill the piping bag, fitted with a star shape nozzle, with the mousseline mixture. Pipe gently into the rolled up sole.
Steam or poach the fish in a little of the fish stock for 15-20 min, or until the fish is cooked and the mousseline has set. Carefully remove from the steamer or poacher, drain well and keep warm.

To make the sauce, reduce the fish stock to a syrupy consistency. Add the cream and coriander and reduce by half. Season to taste and add the lemon juice. Spoon the sauce onto warmed serving plates and add the fish.

title: Rosettes of salmon and sole served with lemon and coriander sauce
